body_html:
audio_ops is available in their nightly docker builds. This is somewhat along the lines of what I did:

  1. docker pull tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3
  2. nvidia-docker run -it -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3
  3. docker exec -it jolly_lamport bash (assuming Linux)
  4. If you want to run the speech command example, it isn't Python 3 compatible. You'll need to fix the errors manually. I believe it's just like 4 lines of changes...
body_text:
audio_ops is available in their nightly docker builds. This is somewhat along the lines of what I did:

docker pull tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3
nvidia-docker run -it -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3
docker exec -it jolly_lamport bash (assuming Linux)
If you want to run the speech command example, it isn't Python 3 compatible. You'll need to fix the errors manually. I believe it's just like 4 lines of changes...
body:
audio_ops is available in their nightly docker builds. This is somewhat along the lines of what I did:
1. `docker pull tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3`
2. `nvidia-docker run -it -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3`
3. `docker exec -it jolly_lamport bash` (assuming Linux)
4. If you want to run the speech command example, it isn't Python 3 compatible. You'll need to fix the errors manually. I believe it's just like 4 lines of changes...
